revised_title: High Pressure Effects on Mammalian Physiology and Mechanisms of General Anesthesia
tldr: This article discusses the effects of high pressure on mammalian physiology and the mechanisms of general anesthesia. The authors explore various aspects of high-pressure biology, including molecular, cellular, and membrane effects, and how they relate to the high-pressure nervous syndrome in humans. They also examine the role of pressure and temperature in physiological research and the potential for pressure as a unique research tool.
